channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12948] Calling Increment#addColumn on the same column multiple times produces wrong result
item.description:
Case:
Initially get('row1'):
rowkey=row1 value=1
run:
Increment increment = new Increment(Bytes.toBytes("row1"));
for (int i = 0; i < N; i++)

{ increment.addColumn(Bytes.toBytes("cf"), Bytes.toBytes("c"), 1) }

hobi.increment(increment);

get('row1'):
if N=1 then result is 2 else if N>1 the result will always be 1

Cause:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-7114 let increment extent mutation which change familyMap from NavigableMap to List, so from client side, we can buffer many edits on the same column；
However, HRegion#increment use idx to iterate the get's results, here results.size<family.value().size if N>1，so the latter edits on the same column won't match the condition

{idx < results.size() && CellUtil.matchingQualifier(results.get(idx), kv) }

, meantime the edits share the same mvccVersion ,so this case happen.

Fix:
according to the put/delete#add on the same column behaviour ,
fix from server side: process "last edit wins on the same column" inside HRegion#increment to maintenance HBASE-7114's extension and keep the same result from 0.94.
item.summary: Calling Increment#addColumn on the same column multiple times produces wrong result

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: oops, there's logic mistake, resubmit
resubmit

Is the change to the for loop needed ?

Can you add a unit test ?

Thanks

ut added;
I need to compare the cq between current and the next edit to decide whether push idx or not, so i used index loop

Test failures were not related to patch.

Andrew Purtell, Enis Soztutar:
Can you take a look ?
thanks ted

Hi Ted,
i just found that according transaction isolation, since multi Increment#addColumn on the same column are inside one transaction,current edit should see previous edits ,which means we should merge the edits instead if "last edit wins" on the same column . if this is true,it'll produce totally different results to 0.94 and before.

please correct me if i'm wrong
thanks

I ran the new test in 0.94 and it passed.

I think aligning with current behavior of 0.94 is fine.

Good find.

Maybe the method should been called setColumn rather than addColumn, that would make its behavior obvious.

Why don't we fix this client side?

Thanks for ur suggestion,setColumn here just avoid the misunderstand of transaction isolation mentioned above ,we can change addColumn to setColumn and make addColumn refer to it.
As for "fix this client side", do you mean put "last edit win" logic inside client? If so, what about open another jira to fix all the subclass of mutation or under this one?
Thanks

addColumn should be deprecated in that case. I agree that all Mutation should behave similarly, although Increment/Append are special in that they're note idempotent and have to be strictly serializable.

A new method plus deprecation of the old will be fine, but we can't at this point change current 0.98 behavior of the old (and presumably to be deprecated) method.
Thanks Andrew，so patch-v2 should be fine here?

ping Andrew Purtell] Enis Soztutar]
Thanks

just wonder why mutation's familyMap is type of NavigableMap<byte [], List<Cell>> not Map<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>> like Get .
thanks

hongyu bi Would it help if they were the same?

NVM. I see now reviewing the patch. This looks like it was an ugly one to find. Patch LGTM. Should we do another issue to change the way the edits are done by family so mutation and get match?

Thanks stack for review
as for open another issue to match the get's way ,i have a concern that rolling upgrade support may be the tricky part.I just thought two options:
option#1: create a treemap to match the get's behaviour from client side but sending a List finally which may need a copy?
option#2: prohibit multi mutations on the same column in one mutation call.
both options seems not that elegant ,just a quick thought
any suggestion are welcome
thanks

+1 on the V2 patch

Let's commit it and then look at the API issues on another JIRA
Re-attaching patch v2 to see if checkstyle warnings are related.
